result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[ma] Cases 20CM392, 21CF23,21CF26, 21CF27,21CF28, 21CF49, 22CF40, 22CF249, 22CF250, 22CF251, 22CF399, 22CF400,22CF453, 22CM117 called at 9:04 AM 
Defendant Jarred L. Coy in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Jarred L. Coy.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Waiver of Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment occur in Cases 22CF399, 22CF400, 22CF453: 
Mr. Coy waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

Scheduling is discussed; ADA Teuber requests a trial be scheduled in Case 21CF23

As to forfeiture of $5000 cash bond; Atty De La Rosa gives argument against forfeiting entire amount, Statement made by Surety, Argument given by ADA Teuber in support of bond forfeiture. 

The Court forfeits all amounts posted. 
recess: 9:30am 

NEXT:   As to ALL Cases, (1) Pretrial Conference on 12/7/22 at 8:30am    (2) Status Conference on 12/16/22 at 2:00pm

[ma] Cases 20CM392, 21CF23, 21CF26, 21CF27, 21CF28, 21CF49, 22CF40, 22CF249, 22CF250, 22CF251, 22CF399, 22CF400, 22CM117, 22CF453 called at 1:38pm 
Defendant Jarred L. Coy appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Initial Appearances occur in Cases 22CF399, 22CF400, 22CF453: 
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within the time limit at the request of Atty Rumpf. 

As to Cases 20CM392, 21CF23, 21CF26, 21CF27, 21CF28, 21CF49, 22CF40, 22CF249, 22CF250, 22CF251, 22CM117: 
The Court requires $20,000 CASH in addition to any cash previously posted, with special conditions to continue. 

As to Case 22CF399: The Court requires $1000 CASH Bond. 
As to Case 22CF400: The Court requires $1000 CASH Bond. 
As to Case 22CF453: The Court requires $1000 CASH Bond. 


recess 1:56  pm.

As to Cases 22CF399, 22CF400, 22CF453: Preliminary Hearing on 10/20/22 at 2:00pm

[ma] Cases 20CM392,21CF23,21CF26,21CF27,21CF28,21CF49,22CF40,22CF249,22CF250,22CF251,22CF399,22CF400,22CM117 called at 9:42am 
Defendant Jarred L. Coy not in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Jarred L. Coy.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance.

Atty De La Rosa has no information to provide to the Court on non appearance.

recess: 9:43am
Status conference on September 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Court's response to Defense Medical Document
Returnable to any Jefferson County Judge or Commissioner
Extradition Forecast

[MK] cases #20CM392, #21CF23, #21CF26, #21CF27, #21CF28, #21CF49, #22CF40, #22CF249, #22CF250, #22CF251, #22CF399, #22CF400, #22CM117 called at 8:42am 
Defendant/Co-Defendant Jarred L.Coy does not appear. Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa appears by telephone. ADA Brookellen Teuber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
These cases are scheduled for hearing on authorized but stayed warrants.  Attorney De La Rosa provides information that Mr. Coy cannot appear today due to illness. Attorney De La Rosa has received a text showing a document regarding Mr. Coy going to an urgent care clinic yesterday.  

The Court indicates that it is lifting the stays on the authorized Warrants. The Warrants are Body-Only, returnable to any Jefferson County Judge or Commissioner. 
On Motion of the State, the Court finds the posted $5,000 Cash Bond to be in default. [clerk's inserted note: this posted $5,000 Cash Bond that applies to cases #22CF249, #22CF250, #22CF251, #21CF23, #21CF26, #21CF27, #21CF28, #21CF49, #22CM117 only].The Court directs that the JA schedule a Bail Forfeiture Hearing.  
However, on request of Attorney De La Rosa, the Court then stays its Orders until 10:00am tomorrow to allow time for Attorney De La Rosa to file the 9/19/22 urgent care clinic visit document. 
recess 8:47am
Hearing on September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Cases 20CM392, 21CF23, 21CF26, 21CF27, 21CF28, 21CF49, 22CF40, 22CF249, 22CF250, 22CF251, 22CF399, 22CF400, 22CM117 called at 11:16 AM 
Defendant Jarred L. Coy not in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Jarred L. Coy.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty De La Rosa explains Mr. Coy's non appearance, cites illness/need to seek medical care. 

ADA Teuber requests Court require proof of medical care or issuance of warrants.

The Court requires Mr. Coy to submit medical documentation with specificity of medical concerns from health provider. 

The Court authorizes but stays warrants until Tuesday. 

recess: 11:23am 
NEXT: Hearing on 9/20/22 at 8:30am [If Mr. Coy appears IA needed in 22CF400 & 22CF399]
Status conference on September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[ma] Cases 20CM392, 21CF23, 21CF26, 21CF27, 21CF28, 21CF49,22CF40,22CF249, 22CF250,22CF251, 22CM117 called at 10:37 AM 
Defendant Jarred L. Coy appeared by zoom .   Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Jarred L. Coy. Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Zoom video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

ADA Teuber has some hesitation waiving Mr. Coy's personal appearance, given prior non-appearances and continued bond violations. 

Mr. Coy asserts covid exposure. 

The Court directs Mr. Coy to appear on the courthouse campus (parking lot) by noon today, and re-login into zoom meeting; if Mr. Coy does not appear/does not appear from courthouse campus a warrant will issue. 
recess: 10:45am--reconvene: 11:54am
Defendant Jarred L. Coy appeared by zoom from courthouse parking lot.   Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa appears via zoom for Jarred L. Coy. Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Given Mr. Coy's compliance with Court's order, ADA Teuber does not request a warrant. 

Scheduling is discussed. 
recess: 11:57am 
NEXT: Status on 9/16/22 at 11:00am
Status conference on August 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant/Co-Defendant Jarred L.Coy in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.
Co-Defendant Jarod J Winkel in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. 
ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Arraignment is held in Mr. Coy's cases #21CF23, #21CF26, #21CF27, #21CF28:

--Pleas of "not guilty" are entered in all four cases

--The Defense requests that preliminary hearing be scheduled- the Defense agrees to extend the 10 day time limit to 20 days.

--Mr. Winkels waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts the waiver and binds Mr. Winkels over for trial

--Pleas of "not guilty" are entered 
---In response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

[MK] cases #22CF40 and #21CF49 called at 11:12am, then at 11:45am the Court also calls cases #20CM392, #21CF23, #21CF26, #21CF27, #21CF28, #21CF48
Defendant Jarred L. Coy appears with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
As to Cases #22CF40 and #21CF49 only, for purposes of today's Preliminary Hearings: On the stipulation of counsel, the Court takes Judicial Notice of the existence of felony bonds on the subject dates, as set forth in the Criminal Complaints. 
 
Preliminary Hearing is held in Case #22CF40:  
Det. B. Miller- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Teuber
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa
--redirect examination by ADA Teuber 
Arguments given by counsel.
The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Coy committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.
__________________________

Preliminary Hearing is held in Case #21CF49:  
Officer E. Grady- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Teuber
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa
Arguments given by counsel.
The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Coy committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.
__________________________

On Motion of ADA Teuber, the Court orders that Case #21CF48 be re-numbered to a misdemeanor case number.  
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling:  the Court reschedules the Preliminary Hearings in Cases #21CF23, #21CF26, #21CF27,#21CF28 due to the approaching noon-hour. Officer Hanley, who is present in the courtroom as the State's witness on these four cases, verifies that he is available on the rescheduled May 20th date. 
Mr. Coy verifies his address as being: 123 North Washington, Watertown 53094.
recess 12:02pm

NEXT:  (1) remove the Jefferson County Jail from the mailing matrix--Mr. Coy is no longer in custody,  (2) the renumbering of case #21CF48 to a misdemeanor case number has been ordered,  (3) Arraignment in Cases #22CF40 and #22CF49 on May 17th at 2:00pm (set on the same/date as the Co-Def's case),  (4)  Status Conference in Case #20CM392 and the forthcoming new misdemeanor case number (replaces case #21CF48), and Preliminary Hearings in Cases #21CF23, #21CF26, #21CF27,#21CF28 --all on May 20th at 1:30pm

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa
Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Conditions of Bond include: 
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--no contact with Co-Defendant Jarod J Winkels outside the presence of counsel  (*  Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.)

[MK] cases #22CF40 amd #22CF42 called at 10:48am 
Co-Defendant Jarred L Coy appears by telephone from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody.   His counsel, Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa, appears in court, verifying that he will be appointed as PD counsel.
Co-Defendant Jarod J Winkels in court. 
ADA Barbara Michaels appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

The Co-Defendants each verify that the addresses and dates of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted by each Co-Defendant, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given to Co-Defendant Winkels.  The Court refers Mr. Winkels to go to the Public Defenders Office after this hearing. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by all parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

As to Co-Defendant Coy:  the Court requires $10,000 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--no contact with Co-Defendant Jarod J Winkels outside the presence of counsel  

As to Co-Defendant Winkels:  the Court requires $5,000 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of drug paraphernalia 
--no contact with the Co-Defendant Jared L Coy outside the presence of counsel
recess 11:03am 

NEXT: (1) as to Mr. Coy- the mailing matrix should be changed to remove the WRC addres; he is now incarcerated in the Jefferson County Jail,  (2) Pretrial Conference as to Winkels only on March 30th at 8:30am (3) Preliminary Hearing on both cases on  April 21st at 11:00am
